inlineContent.text: The main reason for using a name rather than simply providing a filename
is to allow different icons to be used depending on what “icon theme” is
selected by the user. The operation of icon themes on Linux and Unix
follows the
There is a fallback icon theme, named
, where applications
should install their icons, but additional icon themes can be installed
as operating system vendors and users choose.
In many cases, named themes are used indirectly, via [class
rather than directly, but looking up icons directly is also simple. The
object acts as a database of all the icons in the current
theme. You can create new
objects, but it’s much more
efficient to use the standard icon theme of the
so that the
icon information is shared with other people looking up icons.
The
protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying
instance.
The default implementation of these can be found in the protocol extension below.
For a concrete class that implements these methods and properties, see
Alternatively, use
as a lighweight,
reference if you already have an instance you just want to use.
